column1: '''Borlach''' was one of the sons of [[Bór]].
Borlach and his kin entered the service of [[Maedhros]] and [[Maglor]], the eldest [[Sons of Fëanor]].<ref>{{S
column2: 18}}</ref> He fought in the [[Nirnaeth Arnoediad]], and was faithful to the [[Noldor]], taking part in the slaying of [[Ulfang]]'s sons before he was himself slain.<ref>{{S

column1: In the [[The Later Annals of Beleriand
column2: ''Later Annals of Beleriand'']] and the ''[[Grey Annals]]'', the name of the character was ''Boromir'',<ref>{{WJ
column4: P1}}, pp. 61 (§174), 64 ("Conclusion of annal 463 in Version II"), 128 (note to §174), </ref> a name later used for [[Boromir (Lord of Ladros)
column7: 15}}, p. 240</ref> The Boromir referred to in the [[The Etymologies
column9: Boromir of Ladros: Etymology]]) is thus Borlach.<ref>{{LR
column10: Index}}, p. 420 (compare references for "Boromir (1)" and "Boromir (2)")</ref><ref>[[Anders Stenström]], [http://groups.yahoo.com/group/elfling/message/16358 Message 16358 (July 20, 2002)] at [[Elfling]] (mailing list)</ref>

column1: Early versions of the name were directly tied to the root BOR-, signifying loyalty.<ref>{{LR
